text: {{Infobox boxer |name = Dharmendra Singh Yadav |image = |imagesize = |realname = |nickname = gogi |weight = Super bantamweight |height = 5' 4" (162 cm) |reach = |nationality = Indian |birth_date = December 29, 1972, New Delhi, India |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |style = |total = 6 |wins = 6 |losses = 0 |draws = |no contests = |KO = 1 | medaltemplates = Dharmendra Singh Yadav (born December 29, 1972) is a male Indian boxer From Sambhal district in Uttar Pradesh, who won a bronze medal in 1990 Asian Championship. He received Arjuna Award for boxing in 1991. Yadav represented India 19 times in international events from 1989 to 1994. He won three silver and seven bronze medals. He won a bronze medal at the 1990 Commonwealth Games (light flyweight division). He turned professional in 1995, the first Indian boxer to do so. Yadav competed in the flyweight division at the 1992 Summer Olympics. He was defeated in the first round by Hungary's István Kovács. He finished in 17th place.Dharmendra Yadav Bio, Stats, and Results | Olympics at Sports- Reference.com youngest Arjuna awardee ==Professional boxing record== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:98%" | colspan=10|6 Wins (1 knockouts), 0 Losses, 0 Draws, |- !Res. !Record !Opponent !Type !Rd. !Date !Location !Notes |- |Win |6-0 |align=left| Neil Parry | | | |align=left| | |- |Win |5-0 |align=left| Krasimir Cholakov | | | |align=left| | |- |Win |4-0 |align=left| Anthony Hanna | | | |align=left| | |- |Win |3-0 |align=left| Brendan Bryce | | | |align=left| | |- |Win |2-0 |align=left| Rowan Anthony Williams | | | |align=left| |align=left| |- |Win |1-0 |align=left| Shaun Norman | | | |align=left| |align=left| |} ==See also== *Boxing at the 1992 Summer Olympics *Boxing at the 1990 Commonwealth Games ==References== ==External links== * Category:1972 births Category:Indian male boxers Category:Olympic boxers of India Category:Flyweight boxers Category:Living people Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for India Category:Boxers at the 1990 Commonwealth Games Category:Boxers at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in boxing Category:Place of birth missing (living people)
